instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.86v
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.86

resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> started at 18 kohms and dropping
diode mode 0.65, NO GREEN LIGHT


<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> PIN 
1 3.4V
5 0.72V 
4 0.78V

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

PIN 5 3.41V <SIGNAL>PP3V4S_G3H</SIGNAL>
PIN 4 3.3V
PIN 1 &2 3.26V (<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>)

any ideas

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.86v
threads.message:
Looks like SMC doesn't work.
First be sure <RESISTOR>R7029</RESISTOR> is OK.

Post some voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 19, 20, 26, 27.
Also check <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.86v
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?
